page.title: 01The area around Avebury
page.content: The immediate area around the village of Avebury is mainly agricultural land of dairy and mixed farming. The countryside is exceptionally rich in prehistoric remains and a network of footpaths puts these within easy reach of the walker. Dominating the area are the prehistoric stone circles with the huge circular bank and ditch, and the mysterious chalk pyramid of Silbury Hill. Leading up to the main circle are the huge megaliths of the West Kennet Avenue. St.James Church, in the centre of the village was first built in Saxon times. The area boasts two manor houses, Avebury Manor(open to the public) and the smaller private Trusloe Manor.
